sentences.english: Therefore, the main concern of Confucianism is the happiness of people in this world.
sentences.chinese: 因此，孔教最关心的，是人们在世的幸福。

sentences.english: The second part is the opposition Movement Confucianism of "Weekly Review" View.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是《每周评论》视野下的反对孔教运动。

sentences.english: Guo Yayan, 24, has been teaching Mandarin for a year and a half.
sentences.chinese: 24岁的郭雅言孔教本着一年半的普通话本着。

sentences.english: In his life, anti_coufucianist thought is one of Cheng Du_xiu's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 反孔教是陈独秀一生中始终坚持的思想之一。

definition: Confucianism
Confucianism
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
New Confucianism, a social and political movement founded in 1920s China that combines aspects of Western and Eastern philosophy/see also 當代新儒家|当代新儒家[Dang1 dai4 Xin1 Ru2 jia1]
Confucius and Mencius
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People (late 1890s)
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
study of the Confucian classics
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
constitutional government
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
foreign religion (esp. Western Christianity in Qing China)
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
